medium: Ink, colors, and gold leaf on silk
title: Rakan with Deer (Pindola)
text: Buddhist “achievers” or rakan strive for “awakening”—enlightenment—and the attaining of nirvana. Rakan could be depicted in a more natural, life-like manner or with grotesquely distorted features. The image of the running waterfall in the background and a deer standing next to a seated rakan figure might depict the third rakan, Kanaka, who vowed to protect the Buddha’s Law.
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
